trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps" description="Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development." services="mobile-services" documentationCenter="android" authors="RickSaling" manager="dwrede" editor=""/>
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for Android apps" description="Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for Android development." services="mobile-services" documentationCenter="android" authors="RickSaling" manager="dwrede" editor=""/>

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="mobile-services" ms.workload="mobile" ms.tgt_pltfrm="mobile-android" ms.devlang="java" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/18/2015" ms.author="ricksal"/>
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="mobile-services" ms.workload="mobile" ms.tgt_pltfrm="mobile-android" ms.devlang="java" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/18/2015" ms.author="ricksal"/>

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses the supported .NET languages using Visual Studio for server-side business logic and to manage the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the <linkText>JavaScript backend version</linkText><title></title> of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service that lets you write your server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the <linkText>JavaScript backend version</linkText><title></title> of this topic.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires the <linkText>Android Developer Tools[android studio]</linkText><title></title>, which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires the <linkText>Android Developer Tools[android studio]</linkText><title></title>, which includes the Android Studio integrated development environment, and the latest Android platform.

trans-unit.source: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.
trans-unit.target: Android 4.2 or a later version is required.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Mobile Services SDK for Android.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Mobile Services SDK for Android.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to see the Eclipse version of this tutorial, go to : [Get started (Eclipse)].
trans-unit.target: If you would like to see the Eclipse version of this tutorial, go to : [Get started (Eclipse)].

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created the mobile service, download your personalized mobile service project that you can run on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created the mobile service, download your personalized mobile service project that you can run on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the quickstart tab, click Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.
trans-unit.target: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the quickstart tab, click Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install <linkText>Visual Studio Professional 2013</linkText><title></title>, or a later version.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install <linkText>Visual Studio Professional 2013</linkText><title></title>, or a later version.

trans-unit.source: In Step 2, click Download under Download and publish your service to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: In Step 2, click Download under Download and publish your service to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new Android app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install the <linkText>Android Developer Tools[android sdk]</linkText><title></title> on your local computer or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install the <linkText>Android Developer Tools[android sdk]</linkText><title></title> on your local computer or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Under Download and run your app, click Download.
trans-unit.target: Under Download and run your app, click Download.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]
Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
trans-unit.target:
[Troubleshoot a Mobile Services .NET backend]
Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
